intro: Jacquemontia selloi var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly golden vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a prominent spurred petal at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions.
